commit_message:
Switch to Pecan for unit tests

This will drop Pecan in place of the old APIRouter for all
unit tests. This will significantly increase the UT coverage
of pecan and will allow us to drop the old API routing logic
completely.

The rest of the inline test changes are due to slight plugin loading
differences.

Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Change-Id: I76dc23fb7b96d82b0da50285bd0aac76142e81e5

VIF object.

Nova will retrieve the host plugin information in ``HostInfo``

commit_message:
Add ``HostPortProfileInfo`` class

This change introduces a new ``HostPortProfileInfo``
class to model the supported port profiles of each os-vif
VIF object.

Nova will retrieve the host plugin information in ``HostInfo``
and will populate to Neutron when binding a new port. Neutron, with
the list of supported VIF types along with the port info per plugin,
will bind the port and return to Nova the corresponding os-vif VIF
object.

blueprint vif-port-profile
Change-Id: Idb206576570f04a6403b933b83eebf9b0f06a91a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 17565, 'name': 'IBM GPFS CI', 'email': 'imanilac@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmmanilaci'}, {'_account_id': 23083, 'name': 'TommyLike', 'email': 'tommylikehu@gmail.com', 'username': 'TommyLike'}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-12 17:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst'], 'message': "docs: link to the api-ref for 3.27/3.44 for the version history

The REST API version history should ideally have some detailed
explanation of the changes introduced in that microversion. Barring
that, at least link to the API reference (if it exists) so client
side users have a breadcrumb trail to figure out what that microversion
introduces. That's what I'm doing here.

Change-Id: If15023b4ff9254fa6a7efa37dd132d883570faa0
Closes-Bug: #1716705
"}]
commit_message:
docs: link to the api-ref for 3.27/3.44 for the version history

The REST API version history should ideally have some detailed
explanation of the changes introduced in that microversion. Barring
that, at least link to the API reference (if it exists) so client
side users have a breadcrumb trail to figure out what that microversion
introduces. That's what I'm doing here.

Change-Id: If15023b4ff9254fa6a7efa37dd132d883570faa0
Closes-Bug: #1716705

commit_message:
Pin keystone prior to v2 API removal

This patch pins keystone to a SHA prior to the removal of the v2
identity API endpoints. This pin should be removed when v2 tempest
tests are no longer running.

Related-Bug: 1717011
Change-Id: Ieae7d4ffd16dfd201c7baed92759267bb433dee5

commit_message:
[install-guide] remove install-guide doc

1. manila/install-guide is completely the same doc as the one in
   the directory of manila/doc/source/install, this change is to
   remove manila/install-guide because I think this is unnecessary
   and also let us maintenance a copy of install-guide doc.
2. remove install-guide in tox.ini file, cause build doc will generate
   install-guide doc.

Change-Id: Ife2d2b366f3f8b2bff8f9dda0f972858e1505a21

commit_message:
Fixes osc port set allowed-address for ports without previous set allowed address

Current implementation does not work for ports that do not have an allowed address at creation time.
This fix makes sure you can add a port to allowed address when it is not set yet.

Closes-Bug: 1687377

Change-Id: Ia53548e08aec0afa8750cbacce353514fa2fe4ed

subject: FWaaS v1 dashboard: Clean up admin_state logic
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-09-14 14:07:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas_dashboard/api/fwaas.py'], 'message': "FWaaS v1 dashboard: Clean up admin_state logic

NeutronAPIDictWrapper has a logic to regiter 'admin_state' attribute
if a corresponding resource contains 'admin_state_up' attribute [1].
There is no need for a special logic in FWaaS dashboard.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py#L69-L73

Change-Id: I3cd0fd9bd3fe9dde27db215565b334e3b33ffb2a
"}]
commit_message:
FWaaS v1 dashboard: Clean up admin_state logic

NeutronAPIDictWrapper has a logic to regiter 'admin_state' attribute
if a corresponding resource contains 'admin_state_up' attribute [1].
There is no need for a special logic in FWaaS dashboard.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py#L69-L73

Change-Id: I3cd0fd9bd3fe9dde27db215565b334e3b33ffb2a

commit_message:
api-ref: document microversions for the attachments API

The attachments API is completely new in the 3.27 API so
that should be pointed out in the API reference. The only
wrinkle is the 'complete attachment' API which is new in 3.44.

Change-Id: Ia22ddbcd86ecd12d74f365ec3c72d0635ff3566c
Partial-Bug: #1716705

commit_message:
toci_quickstart: Report exit value of deployment to dlrn api

The script does not stop if deployment fails. With current
implementation, the script was always success to dlrn.
Fixing to change success value based on the deployment exit_value

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 17565, 'name': 'IBM GPFS CI', 'email': 'imanilac@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmmanilaci'}, {'_account_id': 22248, 'name': 'HPE STORAGE CI', 'email': 'hp.cinder.blr.ci@groups.ext.hpe.com', 'username': 'hp-storage-blr-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25243, 'name': 'NetApp CI', 'username': 'NetApp-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-12 04:29:36.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'doc/source/_static/manila.conf.sample', 'doc/.gitignore'], 'message': 'Remove auto generated files and unnecessary .gitignore file

1. doc/source/_static will be auto generated when build docs and usually
   cause difference with the original one after doc building.
2. manila/doc/.gitignore file is unnecessary because manila/.gitignore
   already ignore the doc/build directory.
3. add git ignore of doc/source/_static in manila/.gitignore

Change-Id: Ibf13e08f0b0b57718d453ee3240d30124940b521
'}]
commit_message:
Remove auto generated files and unnecessary .gitignore file

1. doc/source/_static will be auto generated when build docs and usually
   cause difference with the original one after doc building.
2. manila/doc/.gitignore file is unnecessary because manila/.gitignore
   already ignore the doc/build directory.
3. add git ignore of doc/source/_static in manila/.gitignore

Change-Id: Ibf13e08f0b0b57718d453ee3240d30124940b521

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-09-08 08:30:53.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/pacemaker/rabbitmq.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-volume.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/database/mysql.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/haproxy.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/database/redis.yaml', 'docker/services/pacemaker/cinder-backup.yaml'], 'message': "Retry if the pacemaker_resource commands failed

Add a retry when the pacemaker_resource command
wasn't apply correctly, more info here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1482116

This is the same approach puppet-pacemaker uses
and provides eventual consistency when multiple
nodes change the cluster CIB concurrently.

This change depends-on :
https://review.gerrithub.io/375982

The return code is not available in the current
ansible-pacemaker package.

Change-Id: I8da03f5c4a6d442617b81be5793a9724cc8842bf
"}]
commit_message:
Retry if the pacemaker_resource commands failed

Add a retry when the pacemaker_resource command
wasn't apply correctly, more info here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1482116

This is the same approach puppet-pacemaker uses
and provides eventual consistency when multiple
nodes change the cluster CIB concurrently.

This change depends-on :
https://review.gerrithub.io/375982

The return code is not available in the current
ansible-pacemaker package.

Change-Id: I8da03f5c4a6d442617b81be5793a9724cc8842bf

commit_message:
Change the type in messages sent by the internal introspect workflow

As explained in the comment, we shouldn't expose the internal workflow
name to users. They should always consider messages it sends to be from
the main introspect workflow.

Partial-Bug: #1716671
Change-Id: I6df3795954b4d17cdc1d82558bbb171a7910c2e2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-27 01:29:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/floatingip.py'], 'message': "Add CACHE_NONE for FloatingIP attributes

'port_id' and 'fixed_ip_address' attributes for FloatingIP would change
when FloatingIPAssociation is created/updated. Therefore we should not
cache/store them in db.

Change-Id: I8cd580c15289a674888f194e8244041ed64bb172
Ralated-Bug: #1703605
(cherry picked from commit b0b2161ca98d6d177de12cc46a6be24c5b3b39d6)

commit_message:
Add CACHE_NONE for FloatingIP attributes

'port_id' and 'fixed_ip_address' attributes for FloatingIP would change
when FloatingIPAssociation is created/updated. Therefore we should not
cache/store them in db.

Change-Id: I8cd580c15289a674888f194e8244041ed64bb172
Ralated-Bug: #1703605
(cherry picked from commit b0b2161ca98d6d177de12cc46a6be24c5b3b39d6)

subject: Keep existing stack tags for patch update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-27 01:29:29.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/tests/utils.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Keep existing stack tags for patch update

When updating a stack, we overwrite the existing tags.
So if no tags are specified during update, all existing
tags are removed. It would atleast be good to keep the
existing tags when doing a patch update (with `--existing`).

Change-Id: I910fe5237605405791eb6daa81c422bf7fd9eaa1
Closes-Bug: #1701098
(cherry picked from commit ed0beb6871b9a64c7a51ea85fd824e7c406343b3)
'}]
commit_message:
Keep existing stack tags for patch update

When updating a stack, we overwrite the existing tags.
So if no tags are specified during update, all existing
tags are removed. It would atleast be good to keep the
existing tags when doing a patch update (with `--existing`).

Change-Id: I910fe5237605405791eb6daa81c422bf7fd9eaa1
Closes-Bug: #1701098
(cherry picked from commit ed0beb6871b9a64c7a51ea85fd824e7c406343b3)

commit_message:
Correct docs usage of keystoneauth1 session

keystoneclient.session has been long deprecated in favor of
keystoneauth1.session. This change corrects entries in the
documentation to use the correct library's session.

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

commit_message:
Enable some off-by-default checks

Some of the available checks are disabled by default, like:
[H106] Don’t put vim configuration in source files
[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

Change-Id: Idaf36281366a3fc5b690884ea5d6376612e779a8

existing interface for roles_data.yaml.

subject: Support different py versions in py2name() and py2pkg()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-14 06:04:59.000000000', 'files': ['renderspec/contextfuncs.py', 'tests.py', 'doc/source/usage.rst'], 'message': 'Support different py versions in py2name() and py2pkg()

pymod2pkg got recently a feature to support the name translation for different
python versions. This is needed for supporting python2 and python3 package
names in .spec.j2 templates.
Add support for this feature in the py2name() and py2pkg() context functions.

Change-Id: Ie32d9a592f29d73b417c6baeb126677cc6a48190
'}]
commit_message:
Support different py versions in py2name() and py2pkg()

pymod2pkg got recently a feature to support the name translation for different
python versions. This is needed for supporting python2 and python3 package
names in .spec.j2 templates.
Add support for this feature in the py2name() and py2pkg() context functions.

Change-Id: Ie32d9a592f29d73b417c6baeb126677cc6a48190

commit_message:
Utils: fix usage of strtime

As oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime() is deprecated in
version '1.6', and will be removed in a future version.

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: I1aca257fbe8b08c3478c5da9639835033b19144a
Partial-Bug: #1715325

subject: Add rm to whitelist_externals in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 21:06:08.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add rm to whitelist_externals in tox.ini

When running tox tests, a warning pops up saying:

WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /usr/bin/rm
  env: /path/to/directory/ec2-api/.tox/py27
Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the
whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Adding rm to the whitelist_externals causes this warning
to no longer appear.

Change-Id: I1894b69a9e459de874b95ee6ba1fb9d060cd426b
'}]
commit_message:
Add rm to whitelist_externals in tox.ini

When running tox tests, a warning pops up saying:

WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /usr/bin/rm
  env: /path/to/directory/ec2-api/.tox/py27
Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the
whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Adding rm to the whitelist_externals causes this warning
to no longer appear.

Change-Id: I1894b69a9e459de874b95ee6ba1fb9d060cd426b

subject: Add redirect for API reference
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-12 22:51:12.000000000', 'files': ['www/static/.htaccess'], 'message': 'Add redirect for API reference

The URLs of some API references was changed in favor of using
the official service types (project-config commit 252673743a).
This commit adds redirect for them.

Redirects for shared-file-system and cluster do not need to use
RedirectMatch. Redirect directive is enough.

Also reorganizes redirect entries.

Change-Id: I8114b28adba7c5fa65566632b3b347ace433251b
'}]
commit_message:
Add redirect for API reference

The URLs of some API references was changed in favor of using
the official service types (project-config commit 252673743a).
This commit adds redirect for them.

Redirects for shared-file-system and cluster do not need to use
RedirectMatch. Redirect directive is enough.

Also reorganizes redirect entries.

Change-Id: I8114b28adba7c5fa65566632b3b347ace433251b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-09-14 03:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_dynamic_routing/services/bgp/scheduler/bgp_dragent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Stop using is_agent_down

The usage of is_agent_down in neutron.db.agents_db.AgentDbMixin
is deprecated for removal in version ocata, and usage of the is_agent_down
neutron.agent.common.utils is recommended in future release.

Change-Id: Idb52516e4b8f916f4fa50a3d7ff349cd06b8f18e
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using is_agent_down

The usage of is_agent_down in neutron.db.agents_db.AgentDbMixin
is deprecated for removal in version ocata, and usage of the is_agent_down
neutron.agent.common.utils is recommended in future release.

Change-Id: Idb52516e4b8f916f4fa50a3d7ff349cd06b8f18e

subject: create functional test framework
revisions:

2. mock the Conductor service to remove disturbing factor in RPC
3. make POST request to test app
4. check the response whether as expected

Change-Id: Iade59c98182d368711f2695fba07c13b7d25914a
'}]
commit_message:
create functional test framework

add functional test for POST method, will provide other CRUD later.

this patch validates the API service from end to end.
1. load the test app integrated with pecan framework
2. mock the Conductor service to remove disturbing factor in RPC
3. make POST request to test app
4. check the response whether as expected

subject: Remove deprecated OSC baremetal commands
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-09-13 01:15:09.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_baremetal_create.py', 'ironicclient/osc/v1/baremetal_create.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-deprecated-osc-cmd-6dc980299d2fbde4.yaml', 'setup.cfg', 'ironicclient/osc/v1/baremetal_node.py'], 'message': 'Remove deprecated OSC baremetal commands

Following commands were deprecated one year ago, now we remove them
from the tree:

* openstack baremetal create
* openstack baremetal delete
* openstack baremetal list
* openstack baremetal show
* openstack baremetal set
* openstack baremetal unset

Note that `openstack baremetal create` is used to create a single node
as well as create resources from file(s). Only the deprecated part
(create a single node) is removed in this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1715643
Change-Id: I0aed7cb970adf23db033c2a951026d649134caa9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated OSC baremetal commands

Following commands were deprecated one year ago, now we remove them
from the tree:

* openstack baremetal create
* openstack baremetal delete
* openstack baremetal list
* openstack baremetal show
* openstack baremetal set
* openstack baremetal unset

Note that `openstack baremetal create` is used to create a single node
as well as create resources from file(s). Only the deprecated part
(create a single node) is removed in this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1715643
Change-Id: I0aed7cb970adf23db033c2a951026d649134caa9

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-09-14 03:04:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/db/firewall/v2/test_firewall_db_v2.py'], 'message': 'Fix mismatch in error messages

Commit [1] changed an exception message and that will lead to a unit test
failure when a new version of neutron-lib is released. Strictly speaking
the change introduced is non backward compatible, but the nature of the
issue (typo) does not justify any effort except removing a brittle assert
in the unit test. Validating the conflict error is more than enough.

[1] 26de187f6036481b20a2d1c22a13fbc4db5c954b

Change-Id: I3b8516582b95cc10b1f691c7538cb7382a8f8a07
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mismatch in error messages

Commit [1] changed an exception message and that will lead to a unit test
failure when a new version of neutron-lib is released. Strictly speaking
the change introduced is non backward compatible, but the nature of the
issue (typo) does not justify any effort except removing a brittle assert
in the unit test. Validating the conflict error is more than enough.

[1] 26de187f6036481b20a2d1c22a13fbc4db5c954b

Change-Id: I3b8516582b95cc10b1f691c7538cb7382a8f8a07

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-11 07:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/ntp_service.py', 'sahara/service/ops.py'], 'message': "fix duplicated ntp configuration

the ntp service will be configured again on existing nodes
when scale a cluster, which turns out duplicated config
at the end of '/etc/ntp.conf' and results in syntax error
when restart ntp service.

Change-Id: I3d59823474b44498e1d6961f328d9b9d6f795ed6
Closes-Bug: #1716307

commit_message:
fix duplicated ntp configuration

the ntp service will be configured again on existing nodes
when scale a cluster, which turns out duplicated config
at the end of '/etc/ntp.conf' and results in syntax error
when restart ntp service.

Change-Id: I3d59823474b44498e1d6961f328d9b9d6f795ed6
Closes-Bug: #1716307

subject: Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-09-13 21:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'devstack/post_test_hook.sh', '.stestr.conf'], 'message': "Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr

New os-testr uses stestr under the hood, which creates .stestr but not
.testrepository directory in the current dir. Other than that, it
doesn't seem like there is any difference in the format or names of files
generated in the directory.

(shamelessly stolen from I82d52bf0ad885bd36d2f0782a7c86ac61df532f2)
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ieee4bf6e3399b1f496850a23ba2e135b61b03f27
Closes-Bug: 1716746
"}]
commit_message:
Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr

New os-testr uses stestr under the hood, which creates .stestr but not
.testrepository directory in the current dir. Other than that, it
doesn't seem like there is any difference in the format or names of files
generated in the directory.

(shamelessly stolen from I82d52bf0ad885bd36d2f0782a7c86ac61df532f2)
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ieee4bf6e3399b1f496850a23ba2e135b61b03f27
Closes-Bug: 1716746

commit_message:

devstack needs FORCE=yes flag to run on f26 for Pike and
earlier releases.

subject: Remove urllib3/requests from requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 15:14:03.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove urllib3/requests from requirements

This patch removes urrlib3 and requests from the requirements.txt
file so that the CentOS Ceph gate will pass.

At the moment, yum tries to install python-urllib3 and throws errors
when it finds that urrlib3 files already exist (since they were
installed via pip).

This also breaks our periodic builds which, in turn, makes infra
quite displeased.

Closes-Bug: 1715888
Change-Id: I2a8b0ebcca9839d033552130688356c055f71553
(cherry picked from commit 353694a9ae5ffcb68dd320c9581097402ebc905d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove urllib3/requests from requirements

This patch removes urrlib3 and requests from the requirements.txt
file so that the CentOS Ceph gate will pass.

At the moment, yum tries to install python-urllib3 and throws errors
when it finds that urrlib3 files already exist (since they were
installed via pip).

This also breaks our periodic builds which, in turn, makes infra
quite displeased.

Closes-Bug: 1715888
Change-Id: I2a8b0ebcca9839d033552130688356c055f71553
(cherry picked from commit 353694a9ae5ffcb68dd320c9581097402ebc905d)

commit_message:
Added UpdateProjectQuota

Accessable at v1/openstack/quotas/.

A GET request returns json specifiing quota size, the current quota,
the current usage, and some details of any currently active quota
change tasks.

A POST request will update the quota for the project to a given
size. The data must contain a JSON dict with 'size' in it,
which will be the name of one of the pre-defined sizes.
Optionally regions (a list of region names) can be specified
which will restrict the update operation to those regions.

Change-Id: I907664f79f6eef0b5239139999cc7a28d246e446

subject: Added Quota Commands
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-13 13:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['adjutantclient/v1/client.py', 'adjutantclient/v1/quota.py', 'setup.cfg', 'adjutantclient/osc/v1/quota.py'], 'message': 'Added Quota Commands

openstack project quota show
 - Shows overview of current quotas for all region
openstack project quota show --region REGIONNAME
 - Shows details for specified region
openstack project quota tasks
 -  lists completed and in progress quota updates
openstack project quota sizes
 - Shows details of sizes for quotas

openstack project quota update <size> --regions regionOne regionTwo
 - Submits a quota update request for the specified sizes
 - If regions are not specifed will default to all regions
stacktask quota - returns data from the get request, including all
quota sizes and the current quota values for all of the regions
stacktask quota --regions <RegionName> - returns data from the quota
get request but only returns quota data specific to the region

Change-Id: I506befd7749100ebf8b8cc2c11f444f067e200d3
'}]
commit_message:
Added Quota Commands

openstack project quota show
 - Shows overview of current quotas for all region
openstack project quota show --region REGIONNAME
 - Shows details for specified region
openstack project quota tasks
 -  lists completed and in progress quota updates
openstack project quota sizes
 - Shows details of sizes for quotas

openstack project quota update <size> --regions regionOne regionTwo
 - Submits a quota update request for the specified sizes
 - If regions are not specifed will default to all regions
stacktask quota - returns data from the get request, including all
quota sizes and the current quota values for all of the regions
stacktask quota --regions <RegionName> - returns data from the quota
get request but only returns quota data specific to the region

Change-Id: I506befd7749100ebf8b8cc2c11f444f067e200d3

commit_message:
[ut] replace .testr.conf with .stestr.conf

In Chaneg[1], os_testr switches the otestr command to use stestr
under the covers. So that we get warning:

ostestr.py:120:
 UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD.
 Please create one to to replace the .testr.conf. You can find a
 script to do this in the stestr git repository.

So remove the .testr.conf and add .stestr.conf which was generated
using a utility script as documented here[2]:

[1] Id7cb2a39a8308f1413608dcf19273a1d7f33592e
[2] https://media.readthedocs.org/pdf/stestr/stable/stestr.pdf

Change-Id: Ibc39d9c3fe33be91be158e7f6cd574736ed89440

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-12 16:08:42.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py'], 'message': 'Add extra time in functional test that fails intermittently

The functional test that checks secret expiration fails
intermittently because sometimes, when the gate is slow,
the secret expires too quickly for the test.

This patch adds an extra 10 seconds so the test will pass
more consistently, while still maintaining the integrity
of the test.

Change-Id: I2f0df9b42dd2bf9dd600948164532fd31bb2a0d3
Closes-Bug: #1499673
'}]
commit_message:
Add extra time in functional test that fails intermittently

The functional test that checks secret expiration fails
intermittently because sometimes, when the gate is slow,
the secret expires too quickly for the test.

This patch adds an extra 10 seconds so the test will pass
more consistently, while still maintaining the integrity
of the test.

Change-Id: I2f0df9b42dd2bf9dd600948164532fd31bb2a0d3
Closes-Bug: #1499673

commit_message:
Remove Coho volume driver

The Coho driver was marked as unsupported in Pike. CI has not been
restored for this driver, and isn't likely to be [1].

Per CI policy, removing driver from in-tree.

[1] https://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/08/31/coho_data_shuts_up_shop/

Change-Id: Ic99d7c598c7a111d856ae4f10ad7de0e45f03d3c

commit_message:
DHCP options for subnet synchronize each time

when run ovn db sync or restart neutron-server,
DHCP options for subnet are always be synchronized from neutron,
it is because there is no classless_static_route for metadata.

Change-Id: I3f1d0bf010429ad08bdc55efc04598f7ccd33426

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-09-13 18:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/wheel/build.yaml', 'roles/legacy-install-afs-with-puppet/files/manifest.pp', 'playbooks/wheel/pre.yaml', 'roles/legacy-install-afs-with-puppet/tasks/main.yaml', 'roles/legacy-install-afs-with-puppet/README.rst', 'zuul.yaml', 'roles/build-wheels/tasks/main.yaml', 'roles/legacy-install-afs-with-puppet/templates/modules.env.j2'], 'message': "Make wheel mirror builders normal zuul nodes

Including puppet madness!

We don't need the long-lived wheel builders - we build from scratch
every time. So all we need is AFS running on a node.

AFS, however, is tricky on CentOS. Rewriting all that right now is meh.
We can do that later.

This gets us to not needing special nodes for wheel builders. Yay!

Change-Id: I6d92c47f4f7a26ca290cd400452cb0a73872b24d
NOTE: It may be inefficient to run this on our low-bandwidth nodes.
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Make wheel mirror builders normal zuul nodes

Including puppet madness!

We don't need the long-lived wheel builders - we build from scratch
every time. So all we need is AFS running on a node.

AFS, however, is tricky on CentOS. Rewriting all that right now is meh.
We can do that later.

This gets us to not needing special nodes for wheel builders. Yay!

Change-Id: I6d92c47f4f7a26ca290cd400452cb0a73872b24d
NOTE: It may be inefficient to run this on our low-bandwidth nodes.
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: v1 dashboard: Fix a bug that rule cannot be updated
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-05 12:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/forms.py', 'neutron_fwaas_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tests.py', 'neutron_fwaas_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/views.py'], 'message': 'v1 dashboard: Fix a bug that rule cannot be updated

Previously firewall rules cannot be updated because uppercase
protocol names are passed to neutron server but FWaaS v1 API
accepts only lowercase protocol names.

There is no reason to use uppercase values in the dashboard
code except the labels. This commit converts uppercase values
in protocol and action into lowercase values.

Closes-Bug: #1700449
Change-Id: I4405f1bed4c29db32d8d6b35b99915d00baadf44
'}]
commit_message:
v1 dashboard: Fix a bug that rule cannot be updated

Previously firewall rules cannot be updated because uppercase
protocol names are passed to neutron server but FWaaS v1 API
accepts only lowercase protocol names.

There is no reason to use uppercase values in the dashboard
code except the labels. This commit converts uppercase values
in protocol and action into lowercase values.

Closes-Bug: #1700449
Change-Id: I4405f1bed4c29db32d8d6b35b99915d00baadf44

commit_message:
Enable redis TLS proxy in HA deployments

Redis does not have TLS out of the box. Let's use a proxy container for
TLS termination.

This commit enables redis TLS proxy for the HA deployment.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I45e539872a03878337def33c681c4577c1a5629e
(cherry picked from commit c6d8df01d7aa8b44af9ac152b3bb08f07e2e02b7)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 21:35:01.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'releasenotes/notes/tempest-deployer-input-548708afc5677f53.yaml', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Remove support for tempest-deployer-input.conf

and stop manage this file.

Change-Id: If6fdc84b341443a5b6727a5d8ec7a7c8aa1f6a98
"}]
commit_message:
Remove support for tempest-deployer-input.conf

tempest-deployer-input.conf file isn't used anywhere in TripleO, neither
by our users or by CI.

The generated configuration is confusing, doesn't work so let's clean-up
and stop manage this file.

Change-Id: If6fdc84b341443a5b6727a5d8ec7a7c8aa1f6a98

commit_message:
Fix unit tests and test configuration

A recent change in the neutron repository changed the
import statements for external_process, fixing fallout.

Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr.
New versions now use .stestr instead of previous .testrepository
directory.

Related-bug: #1716746
Change-Id: Iba7579f8de63c6ce87d95167918fc46979702a35

subject: Fix deadlock when logging from a tpool thread.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-13 04:15:47.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix deadlock when logging from a tpool thread.

The object server runs certain IO-intensive methods outside the main
pthread for performance. If one of those methods tries to log, this can
cause a crash that eventually leads to an object server with hundreds
or thousands of greenthreads, all deadlocked.

The short version of the story is that logging.SysLogHandler has a
mutex which Eventlet monkey-patches. However, the monkey-patched mutex
sometimes breaks if used across different pthreads, and it breaks in
such a way that it is still considered held. After that happens, any
attempt to emit a log message blocks the calling greenthread forever.

The fix is to use a mutex that works across different greenlets and
across different pthreads. This patch introduces such a lock based on
an anonymous pipe.

Change-Id: I57decefaf5bbed57b97a62d0df8518b112917480
Closes-Bug: 1710328
(cherry picked from commit 6d160797fc3257942618a7914d526911ebbda328)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deadlock when logging from a tpool thread.

The object server runs certain IO-intensive methods outside the main
pthread for performance. If one of those methods tries to log, this can
cause a crash that eventually leads to an object server with hundreds
or thousands of greenthreads, all deadlocked.

The short version of the story is that logging.SysLogHandler has a
mutex which Eventlet monkey-patches. However, the monkey-patched mutex
sometimes breaks if used across different pthreads, and it breaks in
such a way that it is still considered held. After that happens, any
attempt to emit a log message blocks the calling greenthread forever.

The fix is to use a mutex that works across different greenlets and
across different pthreads. This patch introduces such a lock based on
an anonymous pipe.

Change-Id: I57decefaf5bbed57b97a62d0df8518b112917480
Closes-Bug: 1710328
(cherry picked from commit 6d160797fc3257942618a7914d526911ebbda328)

commit_message:
Fix deadlock when logging from a tpool thread.

The object server runs certain IO-intensive methods outside the main
pthread for performance. If one of those methods tries to log, this can
cause a crash that eventually leads to an object server with hundreds
or thousands of greenthreads, all deadlocked.

The short version of the story is that logging.SysLogHandler has a
mutex which Eventlet monkey-patches. However, the monkey-patched mutex
sometimes breaks if used across different pthreads, and it breaks in
such a way that it is still considered held. After that happens, any
attempt to emit a log message blocks the calling greenthread forever.

The fix is to use a mutex that works across different greenlets and
across different pthreads. This patch introduces such a lock based on
an anonymous pipe.

Change-Id: I57decefaf5bbed57b97a62d0df8518b112917480
Closes-Bug: 1710328
(cherry picked from commit 6d160797fc3257942618a7914d526911ebbda328)

commit_message:
CountableResource: try count/get functions for all plugins

It's of no guarantee that core plugin implements counter/getter function
for a CountableResource. Instead of just trying core plugin, try every
plugin registered in the directory.

To retain backwards compatibility, we also make sure that core plugin is
checked first.

Change-Id: I5245e217e1f44281f85febbdfaf873321253dc5d
Closes-Bug: #1714769
(cherry picked from commit 07bfe6adb96ee0a88b9dd54d7e4b0bb684b63e3c)

It also fixes a bug when using the "--dump-json" option - until now it

'}]
commit_message:
Make swift-dispersion-report importable

This patch allows to import the dispersion report tool, and thus making
it more easily usable within other Python tools. This can be also used
in a follow up patch to add some tests for the report tool.

It also fixes a bug when using the "--dump-json" option - until now it
returned the policy name and made the JSON invalid.

Change-Id: Ie0d52a1a54fc152bb72cbb3f84dcc36a8dad972a

This patch removes urrlib3 and requests from the requirements.txt
file so that the CentOS Ceph gate will pass.

At the moment, yum tries to install python-urllib3 and throws errors
when it finds that urrlib3 files already exist (since they were
installed via pip).

This also breaks our periodic builds which, in turn, makes infra
quite displeased.

Closes-Bug: 1715888
Change-Id: I2a8b0ebcca9839d033552130688356c055f71553
(cherry picked from commit 7cdc85aa72125c4ff13942c36b2669444026e290)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove urllib3/requests from requirements

This patch removes urrlib3 and requests from the requirements.txt
file so that the CentOS Ceph gate will pass.

At the moment, yum tries to install python-urllib3 and throws errors
when it finds that urrlib3 files already exist (since they were
installed via pip).

This also breaks our periodic builds which, in turn, makes infra
quite displeased.

Closes-Bug: 1715888
Change-Id: I2a8b0ebcca9839d033552130688356c055f71553
(cherry picked from commit 7cdc85aa72125c4ff13942c36b2669444026e290)

commit_message:
Inspur Cinder FC/iSCSI driver

Features that Inspur Driver support:
Create, list, delete, attach (map), and detach (unmap) volumes
Create, list, and delete volume snapshots
Copy an image to a volume
Copy a volume to an image
Clone a volume
Extend a volume
Retype a volume
Create a volume from a snapshot
Manage an existing volume
Consistency group create,update,delete
Consistency group snapshot create,delete
Group create,update,delete
Group snapshot create,delete
Replication V2.1

ThirdPartySystems: INSPUR-CI

Implements: Blueprint inspur-instorage-driver

Change-Id: Ie4f4f99169c1d13ba7c17a0b88f0189e131f559a

commit_message:
Revert second repo-setup run for overcloud nodes

This commit reverts the workaround that was the second run of repo-setup
on overcloud noeds. This workaround was a short-term fix to allow stable
releases to use CI, however a better fix has been created involving the
refactoring of the vxlan networking code that is dependent on this
patch.

Change-Id: Ibcb7d4e0ef603b94a9b8f59b8f81450919c1a371

commit_message:
Add tox environment to test against liberasurecode master

Go clone liberasurecode to our tox env directory, install it
there, and tell setuptools/distutils to use it.

To checkout something *other* than tip-of-master, set LIBERASURECODE_REF
to the remote ref you're interested in.

Change-Id: I13417e058a340ba0d4a79080f0e05dea1be193fc

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-09-12 14:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['ci/environments/scenario001-multinode-containers.yaml', 'docker/services/ceph-ansible/ceph-osd.yaml', 'docker/services/ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml'], 'message': 'Add CephConfigOverrides to allow arbitrary configs in ceph.conf

We need to reuse the ceph_conf_overrides structure provided by
ceph-ansible for both user provided configs and TripleO managed
configs. This change merges the special user facing parameter
with the TripleO generated configs.

Also adds osd_scenario and osd_objectstore params for compatibility
with newer ceph-ansible versions.

Change-Id: I29c689c6c689590da5b6a3f581fdbec98a52e207
Closes-Bug: #1715321
(cherry picked from commit 32bc2abf14af4ca1449e18b848e2be3cff013987)
'}]
commit_message:
Add CephConfigOverrides to allow arbitrary configs in ceph.conf

We need to reuse the ceph_conf_overrides structure provided by
ceph-ansible for both user provided configs and TripleO managed
configs. This change merges the special user facing parameter
with the TripleO generated configs.

Also adds osd_scenario and osd_objectstore params for compatibility
with newer ceph-ansible versions.

Change-Id: I29c689c6c689590da5b6a3f581fdbec98a52e207
Closes-Bug: #1715321
(cherry picked from commit 32bc2abf14af4ca1449e18b848e2be3cff013987)

openshift v2 will be deprecated, and we can't no longer use it.

commit_message:

ansible doesn't automatically log the arguments to this module
(since they include all of the hostvars which include way too much
data).

subject: Re-adding the missing NTP default vars
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-13 16:10:15.000000000', 'files': ['templates/chrony.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Re-adding the missing NTP default vars

Some of the NTP defaults used to deploy chrony were shared between
both the RHEL6 and RHEL7 STIG tasks, however the required defaults
for these vars were removed in
Iaae52c97a35d82dd807ef78a1a6593ce3aa33540.

Since they are still needed by the RHEL7 STIG chrony deployment
we will need to add them back.

I also removed a reference to "security_disable_ipv6" in the chrony
config file which was used to determine if Chrony should bind ::1 for
its management socket. Since the "security_disable_ipv6" var no longer
exists, we will unconditionally bind the ::1 management address.

Change-Id: Ic80bda5fbf5cb4424e305ff9839121416b8bea19
'}]
commit_message:
Re-adding the missing NTP default vars

Some of the NTP defaults used to deploy chrony were shared between
both the RHEL6 and RHEL7 STIG tasks, however the required defaults
for these vars were removed in
Iaae52c97a35d82dd807ef78a1a6593ce3aa33540.

Since they are still needed by the RHEL7 STIG chrony deployment
we will need to add them back.

I also removed a reference to "security_disable_ipv6" in the chrony
config file which was used to determine if Chrony should bind ::1 for
its management socket. Since the "security_disable_ipv6" var no longer
exists, we will unconditionally bind the ::1 management address.

Change-Id: Ic80bda5fbf5cb4424e305ff9839121416b8bea19

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove use of deprecated state=running

As highlighted by the following warning :

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: state=running is deprecated. Please use state=started.
This feature will be removed in version 2.7. Deprecation warnings can be
disabled by setting deprecation_warnings=False in ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: Ib12cb3713667c4edb725f0040086bad7daf9a9b7

subject: Add PyJWT to global requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 16:00:45.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add PyJWT to global requirements

JWT is a standardized bearer token format[0][1]. Keystone will be
adding support for JWT tokens as an alternative to Fernet
(which is effectively unmaintained). PyJWT is the implementation
of JWT for python.

The consumer for PyJWT will be Keystone.

PyJWT is MIT licensed [2].

PyJWT looks to be well written.

PyJWT is actively maintained (last update as of this commit message was
8 days ago).

PyJWT is Python3 compatible (3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6)[2]

PyJWT is packaged for Fedora[3] and Ubuntu[4].

PyJWT functionality is not easily replicated by another library in
global-requirements. It is the expected Python implementation of
JWT functionality.

Currently PyJWT only requires Cryptography >= 1.4 as a runtime
dependency.

[0] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519
[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7797
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/PyJWT/1.5.3
[3] https://www.rpmfind.net/linux/rpm2html/search.php?query=python-jwt
[4] https://packages.ubuntu.com/source/xenial/pyjwt

Change-Id: Ie192823572bc5b0d1d290853920afeae80217a53
'}]
commit_message:
Add PyJWT to global requirements

JWT is a standardized bearer token format[0][1]. Keystone will be
adding support for JWT tokens as an alternative to Fernet
(which is effectively unmaintained). PyJWT is the implementation
of JWT for python.

The consumer for PyJWT will be Keystone.

PyJWT is MIT licensed [2].

PyJWT looks to be well written.

PyJWT is actively maintained (last update as of this commit message was
8 days ago).

PyJWT is Python3 compatible (3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6)[2]

PyJWT is packaged for Fedora[3] and Ubuntu[4].

PyJWT functionality is not easily replicated by another library in
global-requirements. It is the expected Python implementation of
JWT functionality.

Currently PyJWT only requires Cryptography >= 1.4 as a runtime
dependency.

[0] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519
[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7797
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/PyJWT/1.5.3
[3] https://www.rpmfind.net/linux/rpm2html/search.php?query=python-jwt
[4] https://packages.ubuntu.com/source/xenial/pyjwt

Change-Id: Ie192823572bc5b0d1d290853920afeae80217a53

subject: Migrate Swift ring handling from tripleo-heat-templates to puppet-tripleo
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-05 14:11:51.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_swift_ringbuilder.rb', 'manifests/profile/base/swift/ringbuilder.pp'], 'message': "Migrate Swift ring handling from tripleo-heat-templates to puppet-tripleo

This allows decoupling the Swift ringbuilding logic from the Controller
and ObjectStorage roles. A follow up patch will modify
tripleo-heat-templates and use this modified class.

Actually this downloads the Swift rings even if ring building is
disabled or if there is no need to rebalance. This is required, because
operators can disable ring building, but use the same mechanism to
distribute pre-built rings to the nodes.

If ring building is disabled, these won't be uploaded at the end back to
the undercloud.

Related-Bug: 1665641
Change-Id: Ifd6fa5b398d98e8998630ea0c9a2ce9867ceba2b
"}]
commit_message:
Migrate Swift ring handling from tripleo-heat-templates to puppet-tripleo

This allows decoupling the Swift ringbuilding logic from the Controller
and ObjectStorage roles. A follow up patch will modify
tripleo-heat-templates and use this modified class.

Actually this downloads the Swift rings even if ring building is
disabled or if there is no need to rebalance. This is required, because
operators can disable ring building, but use the same mechanism to
distribute pre-built rings to the nodes.

If ring building is disabled, these won't be uploaded at the end back to
the undercloud.

Related-Bug: 1665641
Change-Id: Ifd6fa5b398d98e8998630ea0c9a2ce9867ceba2b

This simplifies compiling by allowing users to include

in makefiles. Otherwise, trying to use pkg-config results in errors like

   /usr/local/lib/liberasurecode.so: undefined reference to `dlopen'
   /usr/local/lib/liberasurecode.so: undefined reference to `dlclose'
   /usr/local/lib/liberasurecode.so: undefined reference to `dlerror'

Change-Id: I39fb137b1a3b6b2beda1d0b28faef3132229ec3b
"}]
commit_message:
Add dl to pkg-config metadata

This simplifies compiling by allowing users to include

   CFLAGS += `pkg-config --cflags erasurecode-1`
   LDFLAGS += `pkg-config --libs erasurecode-1`

in makefiles. Otherwise, trying to use pkg-config results in errors like

   /usr/local/lib/liberasurecode.so: undefined reference to `dlopen'
   /usr/local/lib/liberasurecode.so: undefined reference to `dlclose'
   /usr/local/lib/liberasurecode.so: undefined reference to `dlerror'
   /usr/local/lib/liberasurecode.so: undefined reference to `dlsym'
   collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

Change-Id: I39fb137b1a3b6b2beda1d0b28faef3132229ec3b

commit_message:
Use more backends in existing tests

This allows us to start defining test suites for common capabilities /
allowed failure modes.

Null Backend:
    test_decode_with_missing_parity
    test_decode_with_missing_multi_parity

Jerasure RS Vand:
    test_decode_with_missing_parity

Jerasure RS Cauchy:
    test_decode_with_missing_parity

ISA-L RS Vand:
    test_decode_with_missing_parity
    test_get_fragment_metadata_crc32

ISA-L RS Cauchy:
    test_decode_with_missing_parity
    test_get_fragment_metadata_crc32

SHSS:
    test_decode_with_missing_parity
    test_get_fragment_metadata_crc32

liberasurecode RS Vand:
    test_decode_with_missing_parity

Change-Id: I9ee9ec3d8f86a10c4c7b5d6425a530b9c44d1156

commit_message:
Make test format strings consistent with test function names

* When we specify a particular backend, we don't need to include it in
  the display string; we'll already include it in the output.

* test_destroy_backend_invalid_args shouldn't be reported as
  test_create_backend_invalid_args.

* Consistently include the leading "test_" in the display string.

Change-Id: Ibd72ba4ae609ad77e8808aa1594b0adb62e34ef0

commit_message:
Remove deprecation warning from tempest tests

Tempest deprecated tempest.test.requires_ext() function in
Ibd52153d00b8e60fb8c89e38d94e358ddc787251
Now it is available in tempest.common.utils and this patch changes
all Neutron tempest tests to use this new function.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-08-08 22:45:07.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/lib/common-functions'], 'message': "Failed to open parameter YAML error while trying to unmount imagedir

When trying to build a new VM image for cloud in SUSE distro
after the image is converted to qcow2, it tries to unmount
the image_dir that was mounted and fails, since it is busy.
The 'umount -f' is not able to forcefully umount the tmpfs partition.
So changing it to 'umount -l' fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Ieff1b369df1f81e2b58a21f78df62f751a31d7e1
Closes-Bug: #1708509
"}]
commit_message:
Failed to open parameter YAML error while trying to unmount imagedir

When trying to build a new VM image for cloud in SUSE distro
after the image is converted to qcow2, it tries to unmount
the image_dir that was mounted and fails, since it is busy.
The 'umount -f' is not able to forcefully umount the tmpfs partition.
So changing it to 'umount -l' fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Ieff1b369df1f81e2b58a21f78df62f751a31d7e1
Closes-Bug: #1708509

commit_message:
Improved tests for non-ASCII objects

There's some necessary[1] Unicode handling in the container server
that was untested and could be removed without any tests failing; this
adds coverage.

[1] its removal breaks plain-text container listings from the
container server

subject: Fix services launcher to handle shutdown properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 14:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/test_launcher.py', 'mistral/cmd/launch.py'], 'message': 'Fix services launcher to handle shutdown properly

When Mistral services are configured with systemd, the services time out
on shutdown. The root cause is that each of the server thread is
assigned to a different instance of the oslo.service ServiceLauncher.
The ServiceLauncher can manage multiple server threads. When the server
threads are added to the same instance of the ServiceLauncher, SIGTERM
is handled properly for each server threads.

Change-Id: I8b739844f6073890324189aee028c0d7da3cc76e
Closes-Bug: #1714351
(cherry picked from commit 8a4fe7f146446201d88237804e007c8987814622)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix services launcher to handle shutdown properly

When Mistral services are configured with systemd, the services time out
on shutdown. The root cause is that each of the server thread is
assigned to a different instance of the oslo.service ServiceLauncher.
The ServiceLauncher can manage multiple server threads. When the server
threads are added to the same instance of the ServiceLauncher, SIGTERM
is handled properly for each server threads.

Change-Id: I8b739844f6073890324189aee028c0d7da3cc76e
Closes-Bug: #1714351
(cherry picked from commit 8a4fe7f146446201d88237804e007c8987814622)

subject: Scope vars references correctly when delegated
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-04 16:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_db_post_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Scope vars references correctly when delegated

In my environment, my computes have "untagged" venvs, so the path
to the venv on nova_compute hosts has "nova-untagged" instead of
"nova-<tag>", meaning this tasks breaks because it is delegated from
computes to a conductor host, but does not use the conductor vars to
reference the location of nova's venv.

Change-Id: I3967cbad0cbcc2214db1ca1f2225f3d140fd1774
'}]
commit_message:
Scope vars references correctly when delegated

In my environment, my computes have "untagged" venvs, so the path
to the venv on nova_compute hosts has "nova-untagged" instead of
"nova-<tag>", meaning this tasks breaks because it is delegated from
computes to a conductor host, but does not use the conductor vars to
reference the location of nova's venv.

Change-Id: I3967cbad0cbcc2214db1ca1f2225f3d140fd1774

commit_message:
Updating import for linux/interface opts

neutron-lbaas imports neutron/agent/linux/interface.
This conf option is being refactored and moved to
neutron/conf/agent/linux. This patchset updates
import statements.

commit_message:
Suppress curl warning w/shell module

Using curl from the shell module generates an Ansible warning.
This patch adds "warn: no" to suppress the warning.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-10 23:50:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/mlock_report.py'], 'message': 'Replace pmap shellout with pure python implementation

Without this patch, the pmap -XX call fails on openSUSE Leap
distributions as those have a fairly ancient procps version that
does not support the -XX parameter. A pure python implementation
is more portable, faster and even shorter than the subprocess
call.

Closes-Bug: #1716066
Change-Id: I2fdb457e65359a1c9d40452c922cfdca0e6e74dc
'}]
commit_message:
Replace pmap shellout with pure python implementation

Without this patch, the pmap -XX call fails on openSUSE Leap
distributions as those have a fairly ancient procps version that
does not support the -XX parameter. A pure python implementation
is more portable, faster and even shorter than the subprocess
call.

Closes-Bug: #1716066
Change-Id: I2fdb457e65359a1c9d40452c922cfdca0e6e74dc

commit_message:
Make resource_cleanup stable

Add docstrings, unit tests and an helper for class resource
cleanup. Check super's resource_cleanup is invoked when
overriden to ensure the cleanup stack is processed.

Change-Id: I9c89ba4efd715634dde6b1182c2025ddf9c2f7d2

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-09-12 21:06:34.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/lib/services/registry_fixture.py', 'tempest/tests/test_tempest_plugin.py', 'tempest/tests/common/test_validation_resources.py', 'tempest/common/validation_resources.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/common/test_dynamic_creds.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/common/test_preprov_creds.py'], 'message': 'Add a validation resources fixture

Make validation resources available via a fixture that can be used
by tests conveniently via the useFixture helper.
Add unit tests for it and the validation resources module in general.

This work in preparation to move validation resources to lib.

This commit introduces the RegistryFixture which sets up a usable
registry to unit tests of features that do not rely on configuration
but need a registry. The fixture cleans up the registry once the
test is over and this uncovered the fact that a few tests
erroneously dependent on the registry being populated - which just
happened to be because of some other tests.

Which the new registry fixture in use, such unit tests have to be
fixed in this patch.

Change-Id: I0faaff07e446e35537b53289fc8980f6692fcf55
'}]
commit_message:
Add a validation resources fixture

Make validation resources available via a fixture that can be used
by tests conveniently via the useFixture helper.
Add unit tests for it and the validation resources module in general.

This work in preparation to move validation resources to lib.

This commit introduces the RegistryFixture which sets up a usable
registry to unit tests of features that do not rely on configuration
but need a registry. The fixture cleans up the registry once the
test is over and this uncovered the fact that a few tests
erroneously dependent on the registry being populated - which just
happened to be because of some other tests.

Which the new registry fixture in use, such unit tests have to be
fixed in this patch.

Change-Id: I0faaff07e446e35537b53289fc8980f6692fcf55

commit_message:

This change requires a heat functionality which is not yet available so scenario001-containers job fails because of the new tags.  Reverting to unblock CI and this should be back after we have heat promotion

commit_message:
Add RoleConfig output to major_upgrade_steps.j2.yaml

I96ec09bc788836584c4b39dcce5bf9b80e914c71 added this output to the
deploy-steps.j2, but missed adding this to the major upgrade template
which means the overcloud RoleConfig output is broken after the upgrade
(until the converge update switches back to the deploy-steps.j2 derived
template)

Closes-Bug: #1716404
Change-Id: I331fa18b456ca2d6c124316d513374e3fe5a5007
(cherry picked from commit 27018b4182d77abf612697cfe54a4fc3ceeb6be5)

subject: Trust certificate based on fingerprint
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 7080, 'name': 'Mathieu Mitchell', 'email': 'mat128@gmail.com', 'username': 'mat128'}, {'_account_id': 7662, 'name': 'Rob Crittenden', 'email': 'rcritten@redhat.com', 'username': 'rcritten'}, {'_account_id': 8116, 'name': 'John Dennis', 'email': 'jdennis@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdennis'}, {'_account_id': 9914, 'name': 'Ade Lee', 'email': 'alee@redhat.com', 'username': 'alee'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-26 15:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'ironic_python_agent/config.py', 'ironic_python_agent/agent.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'ironic_python_agent/utils.py', 'ironic_python_agent/ironic_api_client.py', 'ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': "Trust certificate based on fingerprint

This commit gives us the possibility of choosing to trust a
certificate based on comparing the server's certificate fingerprint
to a fingerprint that we can provide as a configuration option (via a
kernel cmdline argument). This fingerprint is calculated by using
the SHA256 algorithm and using a resulting hex string.

Note that if no fingerprint is given from the configuration, a check
is not done and IPA proceeds to the same path it had before.

The workflow given a fingerprint is as follows:

* Check if the API URL is configured to use 'https' and if the
  fingerprint was given.
* Fetch the server's certificate.
* Compare the server's certificate fingerprint to the given
  fingerprint.
* If the comparison failed, an exception is raised.
* If the comparison passes, the certificate is written to a temporary
  file and later used to create the requests session, being set as a
  trusted certificate.

Closes-Bug: #1616495
Change-Id: I59b9694bfb04afdcd0d1ec08efae447b7a6e356d
"}]
commit_message:
Trust certificate based on fingerprint

This commit gives us the possibility of choosing to trust a
certificate based on comparing the server's certificate fingerprint
to a fingerprint that we can provide as a configuration option (via a
kernel cmdline argument). This fingerprint is calculated by using
the SHA256 algorithm and using a resulting hex string.

Note that if no fingerprint is given from the configuration, a check
is not done and IPA proceeds to the same path it had before.

The workflow given a fingerprint is as follows:

* Check if the API URL is configured to use 'https' and if the
  fingerprint was given.
* Fetch the server's certificate.
* Compare the server's certificate fingerprint to the given
  fingerprint.
* If the comparison failed, an exception is raised.
* If the comparison passes, the certificate is written to a temporary
  file and later used to create the requests session, being set as a
  trusted certificate.

Closes-Bug: #1616495
Change-Id: I59b9694bfb04afdcd0d1ec08efae447b7a6e356d

subject: DellEMC ScaleIO chart to configure secret and StorageClass
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 13:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['scaleio/Chart.yaml', 'Makefile', 'scaleio/templates/storage.yaml', 'scaleio/values.yaml', 'scaleio/.helmignore', 'scaleio/templates/secrets.yaml'], 'message': 'DellEMC ScaleIO chart to configure secret and StorageClass

New ScaleIO chart to configure StorageClass in order
to leverage ScaleIO volumes through new client
introduced in Kubernetes 1.6. OpenStack charts like
mariadb can leverage ScaleIO volumes for their storage
needs.

Reference to ScaleIO Kubernetes client.
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/examples/volumes/scaleio

Previously attempted to submit this code https://review.openstack.org/#/c/465695/2
Pete Birley and Michal Dulko suggested to create the scaleio chart under openstack-helm-infra
so here it is!

Change-Id: I60faf248a9c33f08e8c677bee619c8fe96ad3724
Signed-off-by: Eric Caron <eric.caron@emc.com>
'}]
commit_message:
DellEMC ScaleIO chart to configure secret and StorageClass

New ScaleIO chart to configure StorageClass in order
to leverage ScaleIO volumes through new client
introduced in Kubernetes 1.6. OpenStack charts like
mariadb can leverage ScaleIO volumes for their storage
needs.

Reference to ScaleIO Kubernetes client.
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/examples/volumes/scaleio

Previously attempted to submit this code https://review.openstack.org/#/c/465695/2
Pete Birley and Michal Dulko suggested to create the scaleio chart under openstack-helm-infra
so here it is!

Change-Id: I60faf248a9c33f08e8c677bee619c8fe96ad3724

Suppress rsync warnings w/command

module. This patch suppresses those warnings.

Several clean up performed in this patch:

* remove readme in the doc/source
* move installation.rst and usage.rst to the new userdoc/
* add api.rst to userdoc/
* add introduction.rst in doc/source
* add index.rst in every folder
* add release info in every spec

Change-Id: I9ea96993f916b753cc1aa16c2ea2983b93922f23
Signed-off-by: zhipengh <huangzhipeng@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Pike doc clean up

Several clean up performed in this patch:

* remove readme in the doc/source
* move installation.rst and usage.rst to the new userdoc/
* add api.rst to userdoc/
* add introduction.rst in doc/source
* add index.rst in every folder
* add release info in every spec

Change-Id: I9ea96993f916b753cc1aa16c2ea2983b93922f23
Signed-off-by: zhipengh <huangzhipeng@huawei.com>

subject: Fix output for subnet show
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-12 14:23:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/network/v2/subnet.py'], 'message': 'Fix output for subnet show

The use_default_subnet_pool column is never returned by the API, it is
only being used in the request to create a subnet. So make sure that we
do not show it when displaying a subnet.

Change-Id: Ie021149cceb8f89b779ad0f3c13ac60420509671
Related-Bug: 1668223
'}]
commit_message:
Fix output for subnet show

The use_default_subnet_pool column is never returned by the API, it is
only being used in the request to create a subnet. So make sure that we
do not show it when displaying a subnet.

Change-Id: Ie021149cceb8f89b779ad0f3c13ac60420509671
Related-Bug: 1668223

commit_message:
Run zuul-migrate job on changes to mapping file

When we make changes to the zuul/mapping.yaml file, run the zuul-migrate
job so that we can see how those changes update the output.

Change-Id: Ib1cac8be499fab280490cbe5a48372b80ff60cf8

commit_message:
Remove support to deprecated '--profile' option

The '--profile' option was planned to be removed one month ago. This
patch actually kills it.

Change-Id: I61f57c6b08f3505cc95cf7db2bec04f6eb12e1e9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-08 10:10:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_tempest_plugin/tests/api/admin/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/network/test_common.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/network/common.py'], 'message': 'Update vif_attach from NeutronVIFPortIDMixin

This patch updates vif_attach from NeutronVIFPortIDMixin to rely
on presence of Neutron. Drop incorrect logic that skips mac_address
update when show_port() to neutron failed as NeutronVIFPortIDMixin
is used only in flat and neutron network interfaces which require
neutron presence.
Update api tests to use real neutron port.

Change-Id: Iffaf3569aa296b4466729cf7f62c92995b6b3723
'}]
commit_message:
Update vif_attach from NeutronVIFPortIDMixin

This patch updates vif_attach from NeutronVIFPortIDMixin to rely
on presence of Neutron. Drop incorrect logic that skips mac_address
update when show_port() to neutron failed as NeutronVIFPortIDMixin
is used only in flat and neutron network interfaces which require
neutron presence.
Update api tests to use real neutron port.

Change-Id: Iffaf3569aa296b4466729cf7f62c92995b6b3723

commit_message:
Revert "Retire openstack-ansible-security"

This reverts commit ea9b39d723a07e2e9bcb2f4a9b423144c93f92bc.
In order to release stable/pike we need this to still be present.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/502063/ is failing.

Once we release stable/pike we can figure out how to properly remove
this repository.

Change-Id: I50308b1c3001371d4554b6c2640bd5384e870a53

subject: Add missing features to multi-node-aio
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-09-13 15:47:31.000000000', 'files': ['multi-node-aio/playbooks/setup-host.yml', 'multi-node-aio/playbooks/deploy-vms.yml', 'multi-node-aio/README.rst', 'multi-node-aio/playbooks/group_vars/mnaio_hosts.yml', 'multi-node-aio/build.sh'], 'message': "Add missing features to multi-node-aio

The multi-node-aio update that moved the provisioning from bash to
ansible dropped a few features that we use for gating purposes.  This
commit re-adds the following:

1. The ability to drop iptables rules to do port redirection from the
   host to private IPs.  This is controlled by CONFIG_PREROUTING and
   the ansible variable mnaio_host_iptables_prerouting_ports.
2. /etc/hosts on the physical node is now updated w/ the hostname and
   IP of each VM so we can access VMs by name.

NOTE: With #1, we redirect to the VM's DHCP address, and not it's
      management address.  The latter seemed to the desired address
      but didn't work, which is why we've resorted to DHCP.  If using
      this address is incorrect please note so we can investigate
      further.

Change-Id: Ib194c314280f2474a2e4dac6d0feba44b1ee696f
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing features to multi-node-aio

The multi-node-aio update that moved the provisioning from bash to
ansible dropped a few features that we use for gating purposes.  This
commit re-adds the following:

1. The ability to drop iptables rules to do port redirection from the
   host to private IPs.  This is controlled by CONFIG_PREROUTING and
   the ansible variable mnaio_host_iptables_prerouting_ports.
2. /etc/hosts on the physical node is now updated w/ the hostname and
   IP of each VM so we can access VMs by name.

NOTE: With #1, we redirect to the VM's DHCP address, and not it's
      management address.  The latter seemed to the desired address
      but didn't work, which is why we've resorted to DHCP.  If using
      this address is incorrect please note so we can investigate
      further.

Change-Id: Ib194c314280f2474a2e4dac6d0feba44b1ee696f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 03:45:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Don't trigger DVR port update if status the same

The DVR path was missing logic to avoid triggering DB updates
even if the status was already correct. This was leading to a
constant back-and-forth updating between the agent and the server
effectively not changing anything but the updated_at timestamp
and the revision_number.

Closes-Bug: #1716522
Change-Id: I88c678ac8a562db91c71edbc71dc43d1ada6c452
(cherry picked from commit 1edd0c792499dbd6c59257a10c901360941dbcf6)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trigger DVR port update if status the same

The DVR path was missing logic to avoid triggering DB updates
even if the status was already correct. This was leading to a
constant back-and-forth updating between the agent and the server
effectively not changing anything but the updated_at timestamp
and the revision_number.

Closes-Bug: #1716522
Change-Id: I88c678ac8a562db91c71edbc71dc43d1ada6c452
(cherry picked from commit 1edd0c792499dbd6c59257a10c901360941dbcf6)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-30 17:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "redhat/packages: set allow_virtual to True

RDO packaging provides virtual packages. Puppet 3 is setting
allow_virtual to False and in 4 it's set to True.
Force it to True to avoid issues when deploying RDO.

Change-Id: I54ade4cb4add005429840eb7d8970d736b1a0b22
"}]
commit_message:
redhat/packages: set allow_virtual to True

RDO packaging provides virtual packages. Puppet 3 is setting
allow_virtual to False and in 4 it's set to True.
Force it to True to avoid issues when deploying RDO.

Change-Id: I54ade4cb4add005429840eb7d8970d736b1a0b22

subject: configure devstack to use merged bagpipe-bgp
revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2017-03-11 22:33:17.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings.bagpipe_bgp', '.gitmodules', 'devstack/devstack-gate-rc', 'devstack/plugin.sh.bagpipe_bgp', 'devstack/override-defaults', 'bagpipe-bgp', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'setup.cfg', 'networking_bagpipe/bagpipe_bgp/bgp_daemon.py', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "configure devstack to use merged bagpipe-bgp

That includes:
* dropping the submodule pointing to github's bagpipe-bgp
* installing exabgp from github master
* switching bagpipe_bgp entry points to point to the correct module
* adapting the startup script for bagpipe-bgp
* disabling bagpipe-bgp ARP proxy (not compatible with gateway fallback)
* enabling debug logging based on environment
* setting no BGP peers (because we only have single node devstack CI jobs)
* pinning looking glass and exabgp log level
* adding an optional b-bgp-lg service that triggers a periodic
  bagpipe-looking-glass
* adding log colourization :)

Change-Id: I085a617464f71b5f94f9802215bbb8f0cc6b604d
"}]
commit_message:
configure devstack to use merged bagpipe-bgp

That includes:
* dropping the submodule pointing to github's bagpipe-bgp
* installing exabgp from github master
* switching bagpipe_bgp entry points to point to the correct module
* adapting the startup script for bagpipe-bgp
* disabling bagpipe-bgp ARP proxy (not compatible with gateway fallback)
* enabling debug logging based on environment
* setting no BGP peers (because we only have single node devstack CI jobs)
* pinning looking glass and exabgp log level
* adding an optional b-bgp-lg service that triggers a periodic
  bagpipe-looking-glass
* adding log colourization :)

Change-Id: I085a617464f71b5f94f9802215bbb8f0cc6b604d

commit_message:
Withdraw doc for bgpvpn-routes-control API extension

Next release feature freeze is close, and it's not realistic to expect
that the implementation-in-progress of the bgpvpn-routes-control API
extension will be ready in time.

To avoid confusion, this change reverts the parts of change
Ib2cefcb6a345887435b754fbdcff3584329d45d2 that are documenting
the new bgpvpn-routes-control API extension.

The intent is to revert this change once an implementation is finished.

Related: blueprint routes-control

Change-Id: I97146127959cc0161892da5fef65c2a4a1598886

subject: Fix services launcher to handle shutdown properly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-01 18:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/test_launcher.py', 'mistral/cmd/launch.py'], 'message': 'Fix services launcher to handle shutdown properly

When Mistral services are configured with systemd, the services time out
on shutdown. The root cause is that each of the server thread is
assigned to a different instance of the oslo.service ServiceLauncher.
The ServiceLauncher can manage multiple server threads. When the server
threads are added to the same instance of the ServiceLauncher, SIGTERM
is handled properly for each server threads.

Change-Id: I8b739844f6073890324189aee028c0d7da3cc76e
Closes-Bug: #1714351
'}]
commit_message:
Fix services launcher to handle shutdown properly

When Mistral services are configured with systemd, the services time out
on shutdown. The root cause is that each of the server thread is
assigned to a different instance of the oslo.service ServiceLauncher.
The ServiceLauncher can manage multiple server threads. When the server
threads are added to the same instance of the ServiceLauncher, SIGTERM
is handled properly for each server threads.

Change-Id: I8b739844f6073890324189aee028c0d7da3cc76e
Closes-Bug: #1714351

commit_message:
Manila-UI breaks Horizon's "Network" panel group

Since the OpenStack Pike release, the Manila UI dashboard integration
for Horizon breaks the "Network" panel group, causing the "Network
Topology" panel to fail and the buttons "Create Network", "Create
Router", "Create Security Group" and "Allocate IP To Project" to
silently disappear from the panels "Networks", "Routers", "Security
Groups" and "Floating IPs".

This commit adds the parameter "targets" to the method
"tenant_quota_usages" that was introduced by the fix of Horizon
Bug#1675504.

Closes-Bug #1715540
Signed-off-by: Christoph Fiehe <fiehe@gmx.de>

Change-Id: I6d8f9ae2ae03577e63cc985d37fcbba824d68a9d
(cherry picked from commit f49f885b32f750c19cda619fa0290ea36503dc98)

subject: Add etcd3 support for s390x
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11307, 'name': 'Andreas Scheuring', 'email': 'andreas.scheuring@de.ibm.com', 'username': 'uniqueName'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-09-12 22:53:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/configuration.rst', 'stackrc'], 'message': 'Add etcd3 support for s390x

Since [1] devstack is failing on s390x with "Distro not supported".
The reason for this is the missing etcd3 support. It worked before
[1] as we were able to disable etcd3 via local.conf. But as etcd3 is
a base service, we might not be able to rely on this workarond in
the future anymore.

As there is no etcd3 binary hosted on github like it is for other
architectures, the user needs to specify an alternative download
URL via local.conf. Otherwise devstack will exit with an appropriate
error message.

  ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL=<custom-download-url>

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/d8bb220606737719bcdf7c5b4f54906f2974c71c

Change-Id: I1c378a0456dcf2e94d79a02de9d3e16753d946d6
Partial-Bug: #1693192
'}]
commit_message:
Add etcd3 support for s390x

Since [1] devstack is failing on s390x with "Distro not supported".
The reason for this is the missing etcd3 support. It worked before
[1] as we were able to disable etcd3 via local.conf. But as etcd3 is
a base service, we might not be able to rely on this workarond in
the future anymore.

As there is no etcd3 binary hosted on github like it is for other
architectures, the user needs to specify an alternative download
URL via local.conf. Otherwise devstack will exit with an appropriate
error message.

  ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL=<custom-download-url>

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/d8bb220606737719bcdf7c5b4f54906f2974c71c

Change-Id: I1c378a0456dcf2e94d79a02de9d3e16753d946d6
Partial-Bug: #1693192

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-07 01:42:07.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/tests/objects/test_audit.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_audit_template.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_action.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_action_plan.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_goal.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_scoring_engine.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_service.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'watcher/tests/objects/test_action_description.py', 'watcher/objects/utils.py'], 'message': 'iso8601.is8601.Utc No Longer Exists

iso8601.UTC is correct datetime UTC field object.
iso8601 >= 0.1.12 includes only iso8601.UTC for python3
while both UTC and Utc() for python2. Less then 0.1.12

Closes-Bug: #1715486

commit_message:
iso8601.is8601.Utc No Longer Exists

iso8601.UTC is correct datetime UTC field object.
iso8601 >= 0.1.12 includes only iso8601.UTC for python3
while both UTC and Utc() for python2. Less then 0.1.12
included both UTC and Utc() for both python2/3.

Change-Id: I0f8796fba6725eea013b3f8d9ad33c10a402c524
Closes-Bug: #1715486

commit_message:
This patch adds initial support for the Contrail vRouter interface

The patch introduces the Contrail vRouter interface object. It can be
configured as a kernel module or in dpdk mode. The parameters are:
bind_int (required): the interface the vRouter interface is bound to
dpdk (optional): boolean if dpdk or not

Closes bug: 1709862

Change-Id: Iecb739e3964bf5307b0605ea1d80d2369f60918b
